p: Other compounds. A series of phenolic acids were isolated from the heartwood of the plant: gallic acid and its methyl ether in leaves, twigs and heartwood ( Westenburg et al., 2000; Antal et al., 2010), galloylshikimic acid, trigallic acid, methyl digallate, trigallate ( Rendeková et al., 2016), and β-resorcylic acid ( Novaković et al., 2019) in the heartwood. According to Matić and co-workers, the methanol extract of C. coggygria stem contains chlorogenic, caffeic, coumaric, ferulic and rosmaric acid, with the latter being the major representative of its class in the extract ( Matić et al., 2013). Moreover, the heartwood also contains 3-O-β-sitosterol glucoside ( Novaković et al., 2019).
